definition: military banner/flag signal/(fig.) banner (i.e. false pretenses)
banner/flag/(in Qing times) Manchu (cf. 八旗[Ba1 qi2])/administrative subdivision in inner Mongolia equivalent to 縣|县[xian4] county/CL:面[mian4]
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海濱救生員通常用旗號傳達信息。

sentences.english: A group of people were expressing their support for the Palestinian people.
sentences.chinese: 一羣示威者亮出了支持巴勒斯坦的旗號。

sentences.english: As a result, some products containing high fructose corn syrup claim to be "all natural."
sentences.chinese: 導致有些含果葡糖漿的商品仍然打着純天然的旗號。

sentences.english: At least the banks would not be holding the whole country hostage.
sentences.chinese: 至少銀行就不能打着保家衛國的旗號，發國難財了。

sentences.english: Is clearly for themselves, it is not the name of someone else's banner.
sentences.chinese: 明明是爲自己，卻還打着別人的旗號。

sentences.english: The beach life-guards usually flag one another for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海濱救生員通常用旗號傳達訊息。

sentences.english: The beach life-guards applying flag one anotIT for communication.
sentences.chinese: 海濱救生員通經日常旗號傳達訊息。

definition: see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
